taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe pectidinae;genus pectis;species angustifolia;variety tenella

place_of_publication.publication_title: in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle, Prodr.

bio:treatment.description: Annuals, 2–15 cm; herbage spicy-scented (lemon-scented in some Mexican populations). Leaves 10–40 mm, bases of distal blades not notably expanded. Peduncles 5–15 mm. Phyllaries linear, 3–5 mm, widest near middles, each with 1 subterminal oil-gland 0.2–0.5 mm plus smaller, submarginal oil-glands. Cypselae 2.5–4 mm; pappi of 0–7 awns or bristles 1–3 mm and/or coroniform. 2n = 24.
Deserts, grasslands, arid woodlands, shrublands, roadsides;
N.Mex., Tex.; Mexico (Aguascalientes, Chihuahua, Coahuila, Durango, Nuevo León, San Luis Potosí, Tamaulipas, Veracruz, Zacatecas).
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety tenella is widely distributed in the Chihuahuan Desert and adjacent regions. The isolated occurrence in northern New Mexico perhaps represents an introduction.
